main event: In Chico, California on August 2, 1952, two separate observations of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) were reported. The first sighting described a glowing bright light moving slowly at low altitude and reversing direction, while the second report detailed an object as a bright light varying in intensity and observed for approximately 5 minutes.
interesting points: The first sighting indicated that the object was traveling at a high rate of speed with no details of its shape observed, only the brilliant light.
Lt. Janes V. Westbrook, Asst. Dir. of Intel. at Hamilton AFB, concurred that the observed object was probably a weather balloon.
The second sighting estimated the observed travel distance to be approximately 10 miles with weather officers reporting wind conditions at different altitudes.
Physical evidence of the sightings and identification data from witnesses in the area were reported as negative, leaving the objects unidentified.
The documents were part of the Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program that investigated UFOs in the 1950s.
witnesses: Lt. Janes V. Westbrook, Asst. Dir. of Intel., Hamilton AFB, Calif. and Robert G. Kavanaugh, resident of Chico, California
